page.title: 04NEWBURGH HOUSE,HIGHWORTH
page.content: Newburgh House was officially opened in 1968.Themesdown Council started expanding it in 1983.When it is finished Wiltshire County Council will take over.There will then be a total of 42 residences in two storeys,some flats,some bedsitters.Newburgh House is a retirement home.You can only live in it if you are a pensioner.The residents are only allowed birds,not cats or dogs.The oldest person in 1985 is Mrs Burt who is 93.In 1985 there are six men.All the rest of the residents are women.They used to have meals on wheels and will in the future,when the expansion is completed, hopefully in June 1985.
